result.execSummary:
The defendant Hailey R. Grundman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hailey R. Grundman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hailey R. Grundman was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence defendant is now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization of agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hailey R. Grundman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Convicton and Order - ERP and correspondence regarding same; cc ADA Kyle Mayo; stj
Sentencing Hearing held on April 20, 2015 in Br. 3 before Judge Jacobson.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:45 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Robin Kennedy.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Heroin/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Kennedy makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 6 years imprisonment to run concurrent to any other sentence def is currently serving - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization of agent; DNA sample; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 24 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Adj: 8:59 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case Called:   9:10am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Deft appears in person/in custody with Atty Robin Kennedy
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  
Atty Kennedy requests ARGN in Br. 3 as parties likely will set for plea as well.
Bond:  Continued

C: Br. 3

Adj: 9:14am
Preliminary Hearing on April 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202- Day report if released.  No contact with co-defendant(s): C.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
